summary.long: Amos is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Amos, who was among the sheep breeders of Tekoa, which he spoke concerning Israel during the reign of Uzziah, king of Judah and during the reign of Joash’s son Jeroboam, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “From Zion the Lord roars,
    and from Jerusalem he shouts aloud.
The shepherds’ pastures will languish,
    and Carmel’s summit will wither.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says: 
“For three transgressions of Damascus
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because they have trampled down Gilead
    with ironclad threshing sleds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon the house of Hazael,
    and it will devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will shatter the gate bars of Damascus,
    and I will cut off the residents of the Aven Valley,
along with the one who holds the scepter from Beth-eden;
    and the people of Aram will be exiled to Kir,”
        says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of Gaza
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because they exiled the entire population,
    delivering them to Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon the wall of Gaza,
    and it will devour their fortified citadels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and I will cut off the inhabitants of Ashdod,
    along with Ashkelon’s ruler.
I will turn to attack Ekron,
    and the rest of the Philistines will die,”
        says the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of Tyre
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because they delivered the entire population to Edom,
    and did not remember their covenant with their relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon the wall of Tyre,
    and it will devour their fortified citadels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of Edom
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because he pursued his brother with a sword,
    refusing to be compassionate.
His anger was raging continuously;
    he kept up his unending wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon Teman,
    and it will devour the fortified citadels of Bozrah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of the Ammonites
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because they ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead
    in order to enlarge their national borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon the wall of Rabbah,
    and it will devour their fortified citadels
        with an alarm sounding in the time of battle,
    and with a whirlwind in the time of storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their king will go into captivity—
    he and his princes together,”
        says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of Moab
because they cremated the bones of the king of Edom,
    burning them to lime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon Moab,
    and it will devour the fortified citadels of Kerioth.
Moab will die in the uproar of battle,
    with a war cry
        and with the trumpeting of the ram’s horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will execute their rulers among them,
    killing all of their officials as well,”
        says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of Judah
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because they rejected the Law of the Lord
    and did not keep his statutes.
Their own lies made them wander off,
    following along the same path their ancestors walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will send down fire upon Judah,
    and it will devour the fortified citadels of Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“For three transgressions of Israel
    —and now for a fourth—
        I will not turn away;
because they sold the righteous for money,
    and the poor for sandals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
moving quickly to rub the face of the needy in the dirt.
Corrupting the ways of the humble,
    a man and his father go to the same woman,
        deliberately defiling my holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lay down beside every altar,
    on garments pledged as collateral,
drinking wine paid for through fines
    imposed by the temple of their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet it was I who destroyed the Amorites in front of them,
    though their height seemed like a cedar,
    though their strength seemed like an oak,
but whose fruit I destroyed from above
    and the roots from beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Furthermore, I brought you up from the land of Egypt,
    leading you in the wilderness for 40 years,
        to take possession of the land of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also raised up your sons to be prophets,
    and from your young men I raised up Nazirites.
Is this not true, people of Israel?”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But you forced the Nazirites to drink wine,
    and commanded the prophets,
        ‘You are not to prophesy!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh, how I am burdened down with you,
    as a wagon is overloaded with harvested grain!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the swift runner will not escape,
    the valiant will not fortify his strength,
        and the mighty warrior will not save his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The skilled archer will not be able to stand,
    the swift runner will not survive,
        and the mounted rider will not preserve his own life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the bravest of elite troops will run away naked at that time,”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to this message that the Lord has spoken about you, people of Israel. It concerns the entire family that I brought from the land of Egypt:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘You alone have I known from among all of the families of mankind;
    therefore I will hold you accountable for all your iniquities.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will a couple walk in unity
    without having met?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will a lion roar in the forest
    without having found its prey?
Will a young lion cry from its den
    without having caught anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does a bird fall into a snare on the ground
    without any bait in the trap?
Will a trap snap shut
    when there is nothing to catch?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when an alarm sounds in the city,
    the people will tremble, won’t they?
If there is trouble in a city,
    the Lord has brought it about, has he not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Truly the Lord God will do nothing he has mentioned
    without revealing his purposes to his servants the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lion has roared!
    Who will not fear?
The Lord God has spoken!
    Who will not prophesy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Announce this in the fortified citadels of Ashdod,
    and in the fortified citadels of the land of Egypt.
Tell them, ‘Gather together on the mountains of Samaria;
    look at the great misery among the citadels,
        along with the oppression within Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they do not know how to act right,”
    declares the Lord,
“they are filling their strongholds with treasures
    that they took from others by violence into their fortified citadels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord God says: 
“An enemy will surround the land.
    He will pull down your defenses,
        and plunder your fortified citadels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says: 
“Just as a shepherd might save from the lion’s mouth
    only two leg bones or a scrap of an ear,
the Israelis will be saved in a similar manner—
    those in Samaria who sit on the remains of their broken beds,
        and those in Damascus who lie on the edge of their couches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen and testify against the house of Jacob,”
    declares the Lord God, the God of the Heavenly Armies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“because on that day I will lay out the charges against Israel.
    I will also bring judgment upon the altars of Bethel;
the horns of the altar will be cut off
    and will fall to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will wreck both the winter house and the summer house,
    and the ivory houses will fall.
These palaces will surely fall,”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to this message, you fat cows from Bashan,
who live on the Samaritan mountains,
    who oppress the poor,
who rob the needy,
    and who constantly ask your husbands for one more drink!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord God has taken a sacred oath: 
“The day is coming when they will take you away on fishhooks,
    every last one of you on fishhooks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each of you will go out through the breaches of the walls
    straight to Mt. Hermon,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come to Bethel and sin,
    to Gilgal and sin even more!
Bring along your morning sacrifices,
    and pay your tithes every other day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While you’re at it, present a thank offering with leaven,
    and publicize your freewill offerings,
letting everyone hear about it,
    because this is what you really love to do, you Israelis,”
        declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I also have scheduled food shortages for you in all of your cities,
    and lack of bread in all of your settlements,
but you haven’t returned to me,”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I therefore have withheld the rain from you
    three months before the harvest,
causing rain to come upon one city,
    but not upon another,
and upon one field
    but not upon another,
        so that it would wither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the people of two or three cities staggered away to another city
    in order to obtain drinking water,
but you have not returned to me,”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I afflicted you with blight and fungus;
    and the locust swarm devoured the harvest
        of your gardens, your vineyards, your fig trees, and your olive trees,
    but you have not returned to me,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I sent plagues among you as I did with Egypt.
    I killed your choicest young men with the sword.
I took your horses away from you.
    I filled your noses with the stench of your encampments,
but you have not returned to me,”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I overthrew your cities,
    as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
You’ve become like a burning ember, snatched from the fire,
    but you have not returned to me,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore this is what I will do to you, Israel.
    Because I am about to do this,
        prepare to be summoned to your God, Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! The one who crafts mountains,
    who creates the wind,
who reveals what he is thinking to mankind,
    who darkens the morning light,
who tramples down the high places of the land—
    the Lord, the God of the Heavenly Armies is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear this accusation that I am bringing against you: 
‘A dirge, house of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fallen is Israel the virgin—never to rise again!
    She is abandoned on her own land,
        with no one to raise her up.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For this is what the Lord God says: 
‘The city that is sending out a thousand
    will have a hundred left;
The city that is sending out a hundred
    will have ten left of the house of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For this is what the Lord says to the house of Israel: 
‘Seek me and live,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but don’t seek Bethel.
Don’t go to Gilgal,
        and don’t pass over to Beer-sheba.
Because Gilgal will surely go into captivity,
    and Bethel will come to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Seek the Lord and live!
    Otherwise, he may break out like a fire in the house of Joseph
        and devour Bethel,
    and there will be no one to extinguish it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those of you who are making justice taste bitter,
    and who have thrown righteousness to the ground:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the one who fashions the Pleiades and Orion,
    who turns the deep darkness into morning,
    who darkens day into night,
    who calls out to the waters of the sea,
        pouring them out onto the surface of the earth—
    the Lord is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is he who is raining sudden destruction
    upon the strong like lightning,
        so that ruin comes upon the fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have hated those who are presenting their cases in court,
    detesting the one who speaks truthfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore, since you trample the poor continuously,
    taxing his grain,
    building houses of stone in which you won’t live
    and planting fine vineyards from which you won’t drink—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and because I know that your transgressions are many,
    and your sins are numerous
as you oppose the righteous,
    taking bribes as a ransom,
        and turning away the poor in court—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore the prudent person remains silent at such a time,
    for the time is evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Pursue good and not evil,
    so that you may live,
and this is what will happen:
    The Lord God of the Heavenly Armies will be with you,
        as you have been claiming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hate evil and love good,
    and establish justice in court—
perhaps the Lord, the God of the Heavenly Armies,
will be gracious to the survivors of Joseph.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord, the God of the Heavenly Armies, the Lord, says: 
‘There will be dirges in all of the streets;
        and in all of the highways they will cry out in anguish.
They will call the farmer to mourning
    and those who lament to grieve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in all of the vineyards there will be mourning
    when I pass through your midst,’
        says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to those who are craving the Day of the Lord!
    How is it to your benefit, this Day of the Lord?
        It’s a day of darkness to you, and not light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be like a man who runs from a lion,
    only to encounter a bear;
or who comes home, leans his hand against a wall,
    and a serpent bites him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will not the Day of the Lord be darkness, and not light—
    pitch black at that, without a ray of sunshine?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I hate—I despise—your festival days,
    and your solemn convocations stink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if you send up burnt offerings to me
    as well as your grain offerings,
I will not accept them,
    nor will I consider your peace offerings of fattened cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Spare me your noisy singing—
    I will not listen to your musical instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But let justice roll on like many waters,
    and righteousness like an ever-flowing river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Was it to me that you brought offerings and gifts
    in the desert for 40 years, house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you carried the tent of your king—
    and Saturn, your star god idols that you crafted for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will cause you to be taken captive beyond Damascus,”
    says the Lord,
        whose name is God of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to those who are at ease in Zion,
    to those who rest on the mountain of Samaria—
the famous men of the nations
    to whom the house of Israel came!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cross over to Calneh and look around,
    then go on to that great city of Hamath,
        and from there go down to Gath of the Philistines.
Are you better than these kingdoms?
    Or is their territory more extensive than yours?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Disbelieving that a day of evil will come,
    embracing opportunities to commit violence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lying on ivory beds,
    stretching out on your couches,
eating lambs from the flock,
    and fattened calves from the stall,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
chanting to the sound of stringed instruments as if they were David,
    composing songs to themselves as if they were musicians,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
drinking wine from bowls,
    anointing themselves with the choicest of oils,
        but not grieving on the occasion of Joseph’s ruin—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore you will be the first to go into exile,
    and the celebrations of those who are lounging will end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And if there are ten men remaining in one house,
    they will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One’s relative will pick up the corpse
    to carry them from the house for burning,
saying to whomever remains inside the house,
    ‘Is there anyone still with you?’
And he will say, ‘No.’
    He will respond, ‘Be quiet,
        because we do not mention the name “Lord”.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For indeed, the Lord is giving the command—
    and he will smash the large house to rubble
        and the small house into bits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Horses don’t run over bare rock, do they?
    One doesn’t plow rock with oxen, does he?
But you have turned justice to gall,
    and the fruit of righteousness into bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rejoice in nothing worth mentioning—
    that is, you keep on saying,
‘We captured Karnaim by our own strength of will
    and by our own effort, didn’t we?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So look, house of Israel! I will raise up a nation against you,”
    declares the Lord, the God of the Heavenly Armies,
“and they will harass you from the entrance of Hamath
    to the wadi of the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God showed me: Look! He was forming locust swarms as the latter plantings were just beginning to sprout. Indeed, the king had just taken his first fruit tax.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And so it came about that when the swarm had finished eating the grass of the land, I was saying,
“Lord God, forgive—please!
    How will Jacob stand, since he is small?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord relented from this. “This will not happen,” said the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God showed me: Look! The Lord God was calling for judgment by fire, and it was drying up the great depths of the ocean and consuming the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I kept on saying,
“Lord God, forgive—please!
    How will Jacob stand, since he is so small?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord relented from this. “This will not happen, either,” said the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what he showed me: Look! The Lord was standing upon a wall that stood straight and true, with a plumb line in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Lord was asking me, “What do you see, Amos?”
I replied, “A plumb line.”
So the Lord said,
“Look, I have set a plumb line
    in the midst of my people Israel.
        I will no longer spare them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Isaac’s high places will be destroyed,
    and the sanctuaries of Israel will be ruined.
        I will rise in opposition to the house of Jeroboam with my sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Amaziah priest of Bethel sent a message to Jeroboam king of Israel. It said, “Amos has been conspiring against you in the very heart of the house of Israel! The land cannot bear everything he has to say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because Amos is saying this:
‘By the sword will Jeroboam die,
    and Israel will surely go into exile
        far from her homeland.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Amaziah kept saying to Amos, “Get out of here, you seer! Go back to the land of Judah. Live there and prophesy there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t prophesy anymore at Bethel, because it’s the king’s sanctuary and a temple of the kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amos replied in answer to Amaziah,
“I am no prophet,
    nor am I a prophet’s son,
for I have been shepherding
    and picking the fruit of sycamore trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord took me from tending the flock and the Lord kept saying to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Very well then, hear this message from the Lord:
‘You are saying,
    “Don’t prophesy against Israel,
        and don’t preach against the house of Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore this is what the Lord says:
    “Your wife will become a whore in the city,
        and your sons and daughters will die by the sword.
    Your land will be divided and apportioned,
        and you will die in a foreign land.
    Israel will surely go into exile,
        far from its homeland.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God showed me: Look! A basket of summer fruit!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he was asking, “What do you see, Amos?”
I answered, “A basket of summer fruit.”
Then the Lord told me,
“The end approaches for my people Israel.
    I will no longer spare them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time,”
    declares the Lord God,
“the temple songs will be wailing.
    Many bodies will accumulate everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear this, you who are swallowing up the needy,
    who intend to make the poor of the land fail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and who are saying,
    ‘When will the New Moon fade
        so we may sell grain,
    and the Sabbath conclude
        so we may market winnowed wheat?—
shortchanging the measure,
    raising the price,
        falsifying the scales by treachery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
buying the poor for cash,
    and the needy for a pair of sandals,
        selling chaff mixed in with the wheat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord has sworn by the pride of Jacob:
    I will never forget anything they have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the land will tremble because of this, won’t it?
    And all who live in it will mourn, won’t they?
The entire land will swell up like a flooded river.
    It will be stirred up and then will sink
        like the river of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will come about at that time,” declares the Lord God,
    “I will cause the sun to set at noon
        and the earth to darken in the daylight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will turn your festivals into mourning,
    and all of your songs to dirges.
I will cause all of you to put on sackcloth
    and to shave all of your heads.
I will make that time like mourning for an only son,
    and its conclusion will be like the end of a bitter day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look! The days are coming,”
    declares the Lord God,
“when I will send a famine throughout the land—
    not a famine of food or a thirst for water—
        but rather a famine of hearing the words of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People will stagger from sea to sea,
    from north to east.
They will run back and forth,
    searching for a message from the Lord,
        but they won’t find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time,
    the beautiful virgins will faint,
        as will the strong young men—from thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who have been swearing oaths by the sin of Samaria,
    or who say, ‘As your god lives, Dan…’
or who say, ‘As the way of Beer-sheba lives…’—
    will fall, and will never rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw the Lord standing beside the altar as he was saying,
“Strike the doorposts
    so that the thresholds tremble,
        bringing them down on the heads of all of them.
Those who survive I will kill with the sword.
    Those who flee will not escape.
        There will be no deliverance for the fugitives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Even if they burrow into Sheol,
    from there my hand will find them.
Even if they ascend to the heavens,
    from there I will bring them down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even if they hide at the top of Mount Carmel,
    from there I will search and seize them.
Even if they hide from my sight in the depths of the sea,
    from there I will order the serpent to strike them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even if they go into exile among their enemies,
    from there I will order the sword to kill them.
I will fix my gaze on them to inflict disaster,
    and not to do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord God of the Heavenly Armies
who is touching the earth so that it melts
    and all of its inhabitants mourn there—
        the land rises like the Nile River,
        but sinks like the river of Egypt—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who is building his stairway to heaven
    and setting its foundation on earth;
who is calling for the waters of the sea
    and pouring them out over the surface of the land—
        the Lord is his name!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Aren’t you people of Israel like the people of Cush to me?”
    declares the Lord.
“I brought Israel up from the land of Egypt, did I not,
    as well as the Philistines from Caphtor
        and the Arameans from Kir?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! The eyes of the Lord God are on the sinful kingdom.
    I will destroy it from the face of the earth;
but I will not totally destroy the house of Jacob,”
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look! I’m giving the order:
    I will sift the house of Israel throughout all the nations,
        as one sifts with a sieve,
    yet not a single kernel will reach the ground!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All sinners among my people will die by the sword,
    especially all who are saying,
        ‘Disaster will not come upon or conquer us!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“At that time I will restore David’s fallen tent,
    restoring its torn places.
I will restore its ruins,
    rebuilding it as it was long ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so my people may inherit the remnant of Edom
    and all of the nations that bear my name,”
        declares the Lord who is bringing this about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look! The days are coming,”
    declares the Lord,
“when the one who sows will overtake the harvester
    and the treader of grapes will overtake the planter.
Fresh wine will drip down from the mountains,
    cascading down from the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will surely restore my people Israel;
    they will rebuild the ruined cities
        and inhabit them.
They will plant vineyards
    and drink the wine from them.
They will plant gardens
    and eat the fruit from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will plant the people of Israel in their own land,
    never again to be torn out of their land
        that I gave them,”
    says the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
